subject: Re: Developments
msgSnippet: What is Bibledit? and what is a USFMed file? I thought that Unicode doesn t have a scheme for Quikscript. Is Kingsley Unicode a special branch of Unicode?
messageBody:
What is Bibledit? and what is a USFMed file?
I thought that Unicode doesn't have a scheme for Quikscript. Is Kingsley Unicode a special branch of Unicode?

Questions, questions, questions.

If only I were not so far behind in matters computer.

If only I could read the Bible in Quikscript (at least parts of it).

If only I could help you put part of the 20% into Quikscript. It would be the best way of learning Quikscript.



--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tim_rice09" <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> Do guys remember a while back when some of us were discussing transcribing the classics into Quickscript? Well, after a bit of creative hackery (find/replace all ad nauseum) I have the World English Bible nearly 80% in Quickscript. Running low on common words, the true fun is soon to start. If anyone has the interest and time, it would be amazing if they could adopt a book or two and sculpt the remaining bits of non-markup Latin away. I chose a USFMed file compatible with the very capable program Bibledit to make versification and layout a non-issue. The Quickscript text follows the Kingsley Unicode scheme so an input method that supports it is key. Aside from that, come one come all to the virtual transcribing hall.
>
